LARS, Inc.

LARS, Inc. - Get involved with LARS events Spring into Summer and Turkey Trot
  • Special Events

Get To Know LARS

Laurel Advocacy and Referral Services, Inc. (LARS) is a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit organization serving homeless and low-income families and individuals in Laurel, Maryland, which includes parts of Howard County, Anne Arundel County, and Prince George’s County. LARS was founded in 1987 by local religious congregations, including churches and synagogues, for the purpose of assisting those experiencing homelessness and economic hardship. Although LARS does not proselytize or engage in religious activities, Laurel’s religious congregations remain key partners and vital sources of support for LARS.

Check out Laurel Advocacy & Referral Services, Inc. and get to know us. We can do a lot by learning from each other!

Find Out How

Spring into Summer

Saturday, June 20th, 2015 at McCullough Field (8th Street, Laurel MD)

To celebrate the first day of summer and Father's Day weekend, LARS is planning a brand new 5K & 1 Mile Walk to benefit our efforts to end hunger and homelessness in Laurel. Enjoy great food, music, and post-race fun after challenging yourself to a 5K run throughout Old Towne Laurel or a 1 mile walk around the field!

Get Involved

Turkey Trot

One of Laurel's biggest events, the Turkey Trot is a 5k and 1 mile walk to benefit the Laurel communities.

While the event occurs every Thanksgiving season, you can still prepare while the temperatures are still warm!

Learn More
